title: HCC1
extract_protocol_ch1: We collected peripheral whole blood samples (5-10mL) from participant patients in K2EDTA tubes.  the blood cells were removed and the supernatant plasma was obtained. The plasma was then centrifuged at high speed of 14,000×g for 1 minute at 4°C, and the supernatant was got. Within 2 hours after blood sampling, we separated the plasma into 1mL centrifugation tubes and stored at -80°C. The cfRNA was isolated from plasma using ZYMO Quick-cfRNA Serum & Plasma kit (Catalog No. R1059) with a modified protocol.
extract_protocol_ch1.1: We used NEBNext® Multiplex Small RNA Library Prep Set to construct the small RNA libraries and Illumina HiSeq X10 sequencing platform to sequence libraries
data_processing: We first evaluated RNA-seq reads quality with FastQC (version 0.11.5). Then we removed adapters from the 3’ end of the reads by using cutadapt (version 1.16) with the parameter setting of: -a AGATCGGAAGAGCACACGTCTGAACTCCAGTCAC.
data_processing.1: Next, trimmed reads were mapped to the human reference rRNA and removed rRNAs using Bowtie2 (version 2.2.9) with the following parameter setting: -norc, --sensitive-local, --no-unal.
data_processing.2: The human genome sequence was downloaded from Ensembl (Homo sapiens GRCh38/hg38). The unmapped reads from the rRNA alignment step were sequentially aligned to human miRNAs, piRNAs, Y RNAs, srpRNAs, tRNAs, snoRNAs, snRNAs, vaultRNAs, lncRNAs, mRNAs and TUCP by using Bowtie2 with the following parameter setting: -norc, --sensitive-local, --no-unal.
data_processing.3: We divided transcripts into 30bp bins with 15bp overlap and counted reads for each bin of each transcript. Raw read counts of each bin were counted by using featureCounts (Version 1.5.2). Differential expression analysis was done by Wilcoxon rank sum test and edgeR (Version 3.20.9)
data_processing.5: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: tab-limited text file for raw counts
